articles.headline: The Texas Fix Is Unlikely for Ireland
articles.snippet: In the 1980s, regulators dealt with the crisis in Texas banking by letting financial institutions go bankrupt. That solution is unlikely to work in Ireland.
articles.abstract: In the 1980s, regulators dealt with the crisis in Texas banking by letting financial institutions go bankrupt. That solution is unlikely to work in Ireland.
articles.lead_paragraph: Texas may not look much like Ireland. But at different times, each was deemed a model of rapid economic growth, envied and resented by neighbors. During those boom times, each had banks that went crazy, making so many speculative loans that the banking system was doomed when the bubble burst.

articles.headline: Afghan Hero Dog Is Euthanized by Mistake in U.S.
articles.snippet: The dog, Target, survived a suicide bombing, but after she escaped from her adoptive family, a shelter mistakenly administered a lethal injection.
articles.abstract: The dog, Target, survived a suicide bombing, but after she escaped from her adoptive family, a shelter mistakenly administered a lethal injection.
articles.lead_paragraph: FLORENCE, Ariz. — When a suicide bomber entered an American military barracks in Afghanistan in February, it was not American soldiers but Afghan stray dogs that confronted him. Target and two other dogs snarled, barked and snapped at the man, who detonated his bomb at the entrance to the facility but did not kill anyone.

articles.headline: Japan Pushing the Mob Out of Businesses
articles.snippet: The crackdown on the yakuza is an effort to sever the ties between organized crime and the construction industry.
articles.abstract: The crackdown on the yakuza is an effort to sever the ties between organized crime and the construction industry.

articles.headline: Worm Was Perfect for Sabotaging Centrifuges
articles.snippet: Experts reached the conclusion by dissecting the program suspected of being aimed at Iran’s nuclear program.
articles.abstract: Experts reached the conclusion by dissecting the program suspected of being aimed at Iran’s nuclear program.
articles.lead_paragraph: Experts dissecting the computer worm suspected of being aimed at Iran’s nuclear program have determined that it was precisely calibrated in a way that could send nuclear centrifuges wildly out of control.
articles.byline: By William J. Broad and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Echoing Obama, Bernanke Presses China on Imbalances
articles.snippet: The Fed chief said that undervalued currencies are hindering the cooperation needed for global economic expansion.
articles.abstract: The Fed chief said that undervalued currencies are hindering the cooperation needed for global economic expansion.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  Ben S. Bernanke, the Federal Reserve chairman, argued Friday that currency undervaluation by China and other emerging markets was at the root of “persistent imbalances” in trade that “represent a growing financial and economic risk.”
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Sewell Chan

articles.headline: Pat-Downs at Airports Prompt Complaints
articles.snippet: The government has asked for patience as travelers complain about feeling humiliated over the more aggressive measures.
articles.abstract: The government has asked for patience as travelers complain about feeling humiliated over the more aggressive measures.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the three weeks since the Transportation Security Administration began more aggressive pat-downs of passengers at airport security checkpoints, traveler complaints have poured in.

articles.headline: Financier Is Sued by Cuomo in Fraud Case
articles.snippet: New York’s attorney general is suing Steven L. Rattner over a kickback scheme involving the state’s pension system.
articles.abstract: New York’s attorney general is suing Steven L. Rattner over a kickback scheme involving the state’s pension system.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steven L. Rattner, the financier who oversaw the federal rescue of the auto industry, was formally accused by New York’s attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, on Thursday of engaging in a kickback scheme involving the state’s pension system.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Peter Lattman
